crew/bov.html.title: Bov
crew/bov.html.description:
Info Location:: USS Sekhmet Pronouns:: he/him NumRank:: Lieutentant JG Rank:: 5 Type:: Supporting Character Status:: Commissioned Species:: Aenar Role:: Engineering Specialist
Portrait::
Note:: Constantly excited to work and shares a love of electro-plasma with Skklarr. Value1:: Value2:: Value3:: Value4::

crew/conrak.html.title: Conrak
crew/conrak.html.description:
Info Location:: USS Sekhmet Pronouns:: he/him NumRank:: 4 Rank:: Lieutenant Type:: Player Character Status:: Commissioned Species:: Haplorhini, Rondero Role:: Chief of Security
Portrait:: Note:: Competitive, fierce, and looking to serve and protect after experiencing the Battle of Wolf-359. Value1:: Haplorhini are the chosen Value2:: Service before self Value3:: My crew is my clan Value4:: Danger and I are old companions
Conrak consulted Val while working on his personal energy shield project.
Conrak often feels a competitive urge to one-up Val.
Conrak saved Skklarr from an EVA situation at Wolf-359
Both Skklarr and Conrak accept violence as a necessary evil.
Conrak and Evi both have a bonsai tree hobby.
Hick and Conrak believe in the versatility of the phaser as a tool as well as a weapon.

crew/edo'erax.html.title: Edo'erax
crew/edo'erax.html.description:
Info Location:: USS Sekhmet Pronouns:: she/her NumRank:: 4 Rank:: Lieutenant Type:: Supporting Character Status:: Commissioned Species:: Edosian Role:: Ship Nurse
Portrait::
Note:: Shares a constant concern for workplace safety with Sorran Value1:: Value2:: Value3:: Value4::

crew/evi.html.title: Evi
crew/evi.html.description:
Info Location:: USS Sekhmet Pronouns:: she/her NumRank:: 5 Rank:: Lieutenant JG Type:: Supporting Character Status:: Species:: Andorian Role:: Botanist
Portrait::
Note:: Expert in agricultural, ecological, and botanical crises. Also a fellow bonsai enthusiast alongside Conrak. Value1:: Value2:: Value3:: Value4::

crew/grav-tholgar.html.title: Grav Tholgar
crew/grav-tholgar.html.description:
Info Location:: USS Sekhmet Pronouns:: he/him NumRank:: 5 Rank:: Lieutenant JG Type:: Supporting Character Status:: Commissioned Species:: Tellerite Role:: Ship Counselor
Portrait:: Note:: Challenges patients to face their inner selves with pointed rhetoric. Value1:: Value2:: Value3:: Value4::

crew/hick.html.title: Hick
crew/hick.html.description:
Info Location:: USS Sekhmet Pronouns:: zhen/it/that/z NumRank:: 20 Rank:: Civilian Type:: Supporting Character Status:: Commissioned Species:: Andorian Role:: Security Specialist
Portrait::
Note:: A hot shot looking for a fight as part of Conrak's security team. Value1:: Value2:: Value3:: Value4::

crew/relek-tovan.html.title: Relek Tovan
crew/relek-tovan.html.description:
Info Location:: USS Sekhmet Pronouns:: he/him NumRank:: 9.2 Rank:: Crewman 2nd Class Type:: Supporting Character Status:: Commissioned Species:: Cardassian Role:: Helmsman
Portrait::
Note:: Saved from execution after the Dominion War by Val and now piloting the Sekhmet. Value1:: Value2:: Value3:: Value4::

crew/shranval-'val'.html.title: Shranval 'Val'
crew/shranval-'val'.html.description:
Info Location:: USS Sekhmet Pronouns:: they/them NumRank:: 3 Rank:: Lt. Commander Type:: Player Character Status:: Commissioned Species:: Vulcan-Andorian Role:: Executive Officer
Portrait:: Note:: Former Andorian military, now working in Starfleet to make a difference on a new frontier. Value1:: We are all connected despite being worlds apart Value2:: Good leaders get their hands dirty Value3:: Act with confidence, even if you don’t feel confident Value4:: You must walk barefoot in the dirt to really understand a world
Conrak consulted Val while working on his personal energy shield project.
Conrak often competes with Val.
Both Val and Sorran share a mutual understanding of poly relationships. [Sorran] stopped Val from firing on a threat in what turned out to be a first contact situation.
Val talks to Skklarr about his cross-cultural identity.
Val saved Relek Tovan from execution.
Grav Tholgar has respect for Val's bravado.

crew/skklarr.html.title: Skklarr
crew/skklarr.html.description:
Info Location:: USS Sekhmet Pronouns:: he/him NumRank:: 7 Rank:: Master Chief Petty Officer Type:: Player Character Status:: Enlisted Species:: Gorn Role:: Operations Manager
Portrait:: Note:: A Gorn raised by the overly cautious Kelpians, now working as an engineer on a frontier that's anything by safe. Value1:: my kingdom for some threat ganglia Value2:: give me a hyperspanner, and I can fix it Value3:: the captain may command her, but this ship is MINE Value4:: I'll use my fear to protect others
Sorran originally treating Skklarr like a curiosity.
Both Skklarr and Conrak accept violence as a necessary evil.
Conrak saved Skklarr from an EVA situation at wolf-359
Val talks to Skklarr about cross-cultural identity.
Su'Kra is Skklarr's sister.
Both Skklarr and Bov are obsessed with engineering and tinkering.

crew/sorran.html.title: Sorran
crew/sorran.html.description:
Info Location:: USS Sekhmet Pronouns:: he/him NumRank:: 4 Rank:: Lieutenant Type:: Player Character Status:: Species:: Denobulan Role:: Science Officer
Portrait:: Note:: An expert in hazardous material properties and disposal, with a contingency for every situation and a curiosity for every field of knowledge. Value1:: Optimism is Tactical Value2:: Every Discipline Has Something to Teach. Value3:: To Protect Life, I Must Understand What Threatens It. Value4:: Prepared for Anything, Expected or Not.
Constantly learning new things from Conrak, Sorran's gym partner.
Sorran once stopped Val from firing on a potential threat, in what turned out to be a first contact situation.
Shares an understanding of poly relationships with Val.
Sorran originally treated Skklarr like a curiosity.
both Sorran and Edo'erax share a concern for workplace safety.

crew/su'kra.html.title: Su'Kra
crew/su'kra.html.description:
Info Location:: USS Sekhmet Pronouns:: she/her NumRank:: 6 Rank:: Ensign Type:: Supporting Character Status:: Commissioned Species:: Kelpian Role:: Lab Technician
Portrait::
Note:: Brought on board the USS Sekhmet to learn under Sorran's wing Value1:: Value2:: Value3:: Value4::

lore/the-shackleton-expanse.html.title: The Shackleton Expanse
lore/the-shackleton-expanse.html.description:
The Shackleton ExpanseFar from the heart of the Federation lies the Shackleton Expanse, a massive area of space deep within the Beta Quadrant. Informally named after the renowned ancient Earth explorer Ernest Shackleton, the Expanse has, remained largely unexplored. Few resources have been committed to exploring the Expanse. Until now, Starfleet preferred to focus on higher-priority regions closer to home. With the end of the war and several years to recover behind the Federation, exploration has become a renewed priority.We have no reliable intelligence reports to suggest that either the Klingon Empire or the Romulan Star Empire have bothered to send reconnaissance ships or probes into the Expanse. Our Klingon allies apparently have no survey data to share, and the Romulan science corps is unwilling to part with any data they may haveWhat little we do have:
Patchwork of probe telemetry
A hodgepodge of brand new colonies just now breaking ground on the nearest systems.
Long range sensor scans
Unreliable data
Stories from independent colonists and their crews who have traveled through the Expanse over the years. Surveys and personal logs from independent traders are rife with unsubstantiated reports of subspace interference, electromagnetic waveforms, and tetryonic storms.No known sentient species has claimed to be from a world within the Expanse. It's unknown why this might be.
Built in tribute to the Klingon colonists who were massacred during a Romulan sneak attack against the Narendra III outpost in 2344, the starbase also serves as a reminder of the pivotal shift in Klingon-Federation relations that assault caused.
Now Narendra Station has become the foremost outpost for Federation colonization into the Shackleton Expanse.

mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-1.1-ba.title: Sekhmet Log 1.1 - Bacchus' Irresistible Call
mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-1.1-ba.description: Stardate:: 67156 Mission:: Bacchus' Irresistible Call Note:: The Sekhmet investgated a missing science team at Bacchus-3, only to get caught in the same subspace distortion wave and became stranded. On the planet, they found the team strange entranced by massive monoliths, even willing to die to get inside.The USS Sekhmet was sent to investigate the disappearance of a Starfleet science shuttle at the Bacchus system. When the Sekhmet arrived, it was violently thrown out of warp by a massive subspace distortion wave. With warp-speed rendered impossible and subspace communications completely washed out by background subspace frequencies in the system, they managed to push a probe far enoguh outside the system to get a distress signal out.Next, an away was sent down to Bacchus-3 to investigate the source of the distortion waves. A small coalition team of Starfleet and Klingon officers seemed entranced by the giant monoliths sticking out of the surface of the planet. Soon, the scientists opened the monoliths, revealing a facility on the inside. Two of the closest scientists threw themselves into the facility, getting vaporized instantly.
mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-1.1-ba.sourcePath: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 1.1 - Bacchus' Irresistible Call.md

mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-1.2-es.title: Sekhmet Log 1.2 - Escaping from Bacchus-3
mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-1.2-es.description: Stardate:: 67156 Mission:: Bacchus' Irresistible Call Note:: The Sekhmet's away team ventured into the spire on Bacchus-3, and found a message from an unknown alien race. They asked the away team to find "the facility". They disabled the subspace distortion wave, and evacuated from the planet and the system, bringing wanted Klingon pirates with them.The Sekhmet's away team managed to retrain the remaining survivors on Bacchus-3 before they ran into the spire's interior. Val mind-melded with the science team's vulcan officer, and found a repeating message in his subconscious: "Find the facility." Sorran Vek found that D'Lok, a Klingon, at a brainwave resonating with the subspace distortion frequency.Conrak phasered one of the two phaser arrays guarding the entrance, which activated a security system closing the door. Conrak rushed forward and held the door open while Val disabled the second one. The away team entered the spire, leaving a small security team to guard the restrained scientists.Inside, the engineering specialist Victoria noted the amounts of power running through the spire was no enormous there were very few practical uses for it all. But it was enough power to punch wormholes through space-time. At the center of the spire, the found a control room with consoles for security, power management, subspace field generation, and more. They disabled the security system first, and then turned off the subspace field generator.An automated hologram projection of an alien introduced themselves as representing the "Displaced." The implored the group to find something called "The Facility" but didn't know where it was. It said its people were in peril and asked for the away team to go save them. It directed the away to to collect a bread-box sized sandstone prism with runes carved along the outside.The automated messenger finally urged them to leave quickly, because their ship would be in danger. The spires of Bacchus-3 was tractoring the nearest planet towards it, ripping the planet apart as it went. It was rebuilding a new Spire to replace the disabled one. A meteor shower threatened to destroy the Sekhmet and a disabled Klingon vessel. The away team and others on the surface returned to the SekhmetThe Klingon vessel had arrived to find their "compatriots", and demanded to have them returned. Val convinced the Klingons that if they allowed the Sekhmet to tractor them out of the system to safety, then the fugitives would be returned, with an implication that they would be set free.However, the commanding officer Vrenta Ewasi instead ordered the Sekhmet to rendezvous with Starfleet vessels answering a distress signal. The Klingons were arrest, and the Sekhmet praised for not only saving the survey team, but also bringing in wanted criminals.
mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-1.2-es.sourcePath: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 1.2 - Escaping from Bacchus-3.md

mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-2-peas.title: Sekhmet Log 2 - Peas to Meet You
mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-2-peas.description: Stardate:: 67197 Mission:: Peas to Meet You Note:: The Sekhmet assisted the USS Constantine in delivering a crucial agricultural exchange to a colony in the Bix system. The crew and passengers of the Constantine had succumbed to a neurotoxin produced by Ice Peas while not in it's natural habitat.The USS Sekhmet was sent to investigate the USS Constantine, a Galaxy Class starship itself tasked with transporting an agricultural exchange from the Colony on Re-Alpha to a struggling colony on Bix. Aboard the Sekhmet, a boarding party found the crew of the Constantine acting strangely. The Executive officer ambushed the party, seemingly paranoid that they were intruders. The Captain was engaged in some sort of wrestling tournament, and various other crew members were exhibiting strong emotional reactions.The boarding party found the crew was under the effects of a neurotoxin called Wexylin-5C, which would cause different reactions from each person as a stress response. They tracked down the source of this neurotoxin to a plan on board called Ice Peas. The colonists had brought the crop on board and were sharing the food with the crew. The crop had been removed from it's natural habitat and was creating this neurotoxin in response to losing a particular fungus in it's soil. The boarding party was able to reintroduce the fungus into the Ice Pea bushes soil substitute, and bring the crew back to normal.
mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-2-peas.sourcePath: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 2 - Peas to Meet You.md

mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-3-orio.title: Sekhmet Log 3 - Orion Heist
mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-3-orio.description: Stardate:: 67217 Mission:: The Orion Heist Note:: The Sekhmet was sent to pursue an Orion freighter which had stolen the Bacchus Artifact. The chase lead to the Romulan neutral zone. Before the Sekhmet could tractor beam the freighter and head back to base, a Romulan Warbird decloaked. The Sekhmet disabled the freighter's shields, beamed the artifact aboard, and fled the neutral zone before the Warbird could break the Sekhmet's own shields.While Lt Sorran was studying the Bacchus artifact, Lt Kassandra Pruitt, suffered a massive neural failure cascade, sending her to the emergency room. Meanwhile the Artifact was stolen from the lab. Admiral Banna Stoker gave instructions to the Sekhmet to find it. The artifact could not be located on the station, and only 2 starships had left Narendra Station recently.The Sekhmet started by chasing down a Klingon Bird of Prey, who turned out to be innocent. This mistake meant an Orion Freighter made it all the way to the Romulan Neutral Zone before the Sekhmet caught up. In the neutral zone, they found the back end of the freighter caved in like an aluminum can, with some kind of gravity field compressing the ship's hull.Lt. Commander Val ordered the freighter to be hulled away with a tractor beam, but in the same moment a Romulan decloaked and caught the freighter in it's own tractor beam. This lead to a brief firefight. The Sekhmet disabled the Orion freighters shields and beamed the artifact aboard. The artifact was still attached to an Orion via a telepathic link which would kill him if removed forcefully.The the Orion freighter captain, Paljara, begged Val to send the artifact back, as it was ransom for her sister's life. Val refused to comply. The Romulan captain also threatened the Sekhmet, warning of dire consequences if the artifact and the Orion were not returned.In the end, the Sekhmet managed to charge it's warp drive and race back to Narendra station. Admiral Stoker commended the Sekhmet for a job well done. But as the Sekhmet retreated, the Romulans had destroyed the Orion freighter.
mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-3-orio.sourcePath: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 3 - Orion Heist.md

mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-4-immi.title: Sekhmet Log 4 - Imminent Collision
mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-4-immi.description: Stardate:: 67233 Mission:: Imminent Collision Note:: The Sekhmet made first contact with a new species made of crystal that communicated with refracted light. They crew assisted the aliens by removing an unidentified torpedo from the hull, and sent them on their way.After Narendra Station picked up an unidentified object approaching the station at high warp speeds, the USS Sekhmet was sent to investigate while the station prepared for a potential attack. They found a strange crystalline starship and attempted rudimentary and cooperative communication with it. On board the crystal starship, the crew found an unidentified torpedo lodged into the side of the structure, seemingly made just for the purpose of attacking this kind of starship. As the hull of the ship seemed to be a living entity of some sort, an away team organized a surgical bomb disposal procedure to remove the torpedo safely. This triggered the torpedo to explode and it was sent into space with an emergency transport.Once the torpedo was removed, the strange crystal beings who communicated through light refraction departed back into the Shackleton Expanse.
mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-4-immi.sourcePath: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 4 - Imminent Collision.md

mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-5.1-th.title: Sekhmet Log 5.1 - The Pasqual Problem
mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-5.1-th.description: Stardate:: 67255 Mission:: Simplicity Note:: The Sekhmet picked up Admiral Stoker and was ordered to Pasqual-1. There, they found a planet cloaked in an electromagnetic field that interfered with sensors and would disable and electronic equipment. It was covered in hundreds of strange black obelisks, 3 stories tall, and was home to a pre-industrial civilization.Sorran and Val were continuing investigation into Bacchus Artifact by performing controlled mind melds into it. However, the artifact's signal overloaded the failsafe meant to protect Val. It was deemed unsafe to continue these kinds of investigations.A shuttle was found rushing out of the Shackleton Expanse and towards the Sekhmet. Admiral Stoker was aboard and had taken damage as if in a firefight. When she boarded, she ordered the Sekhmet to head towards the Pasqual system in the Shackleton. Investigation into the shuttle revealed that she had indeed gotten into a fight with an unknown civilization. Her shuttle had visited several systems in the Shackleton.After cleaning up, Stoker briefed the crew on their mission: Pasqual-1 was an M-Class planet with a strange electromagnetic field shielding it from sensors. Stoker expected this planet might have remnants from the same civilization as Bacchus. The crew was also to keep a lookout for enemy ships that may have followed Stoker's shuttleAfter the briefing, Stoker took Conrak and Val aside and made it clear that the civilian Hik was to be enlisted into the Starfleet command structure or be removed from the ship's crew. Hik would be given a suitable position for her experience.The Sekhmet arrived at Pasqual-1 and found it covered in approximately 500 black obsidian monoliths, each about 3 stories tall. Each one had a small settlement build around it from a pre-industrial civilization.The Sekhmet put together an away team for Pasqual-1, and beamed down even through the electromagnetic interference. They aimed several kilometers outside a settlement and intended to work their way in to investigate the monolith there. In the woods, the away team was attacked by 4 panther-like predators, which were then killed or scared away.On the way to the nearest monolith, the away team followed a river until they found a woman and two children by a waterfall. They were doing laundry. Each one looked to be a different species than the others altogether.
mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-5.1-th.sourcePath: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 5.1 - The Pasqual Problem.md

mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-5.2-mo.title: Sekhmet Log 5.2 - Monoliths
mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-5.2-mo.description: Stardate:: 67255 Mission:: Simplicity Note:: Val, Conrak, Sorren, and Karnes explored Pasqual-1 and followed some locals back to a community built around a black monolith. They discovered that the monolith was performing genetic experiments and forcefully evolving the population, and then attempting to send it to the Seku system. The electromagnetic field seemed to be an unintended interaction of the monoliths and the planet's crust.Val, Conrak, Sorren, and Karnes approached the three locals of Pasqual-1 at the waterfall. After making introductions, Val was able to mind meld with the locals to communicate. The woman introduced herself as Zumala, and the two children were Tadbon and Klopflim. Val hid their true origins from Zumala during the mind meld, but Zumala was able to sense him holding back information.The away team followed the three Pasqualese into their town, and were introduced to their elder, Jasper. Sorren and Val investigated the monolith in the center of town while Conrak aquainted himself with the locals.During a shared dinner outdoors, the monolith lit up in blue lights and 12 people around it fell to the ground, convulsing as it electrocuted. The people of the village seemed worried about it, but expected it to happen.Val convinced Jasper to bring them underneath the monolith, which Jasper considered holy ground. But in the mind meld, Jasper gleaned that the away team with from the stars and interpreted that as the team being angels. He asked them to bring him with them to the stars and Val agreed (at least temporarily.)Underneath the monolith, the away team found a control room. After some investigation, they discovered the control room was attempting to send genetic information from the community out to the Seku system in the Shackleton Expanse. They also found that every 6 months or so, the tower would send a signal out to several members of the community to revise their DNA, and then their children would be born with new features.With this information, the away team decided to return to the transport pickup spot. They brought Jasper, but Jasper was left behind as they were beamed back onto the Sekhmet. The Sekhmet was in red alert, and under attack.

mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-5.3-vi.title: Sekhmet Log 5.3 - Vinshari Attack
mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-5.3-vi.description: Stardate:: 67255 Mission:: Simplicity Note:: When the away team on Pasqual-1 returned to the Sekhmet, it was under attack from a starship crewed by the Vinshari, a new civilization. Conrak and Val were able to work efficiently as a team and quickly disabled the starship. The Vinshari claimed that the Admiral had stolen from them, and demanded the Admiral be handed over to them to face justice. In the end, Admiral Stoker was arrested for attempting to destroy the Vinshari starship while it was defenseless.The away team on Pasqual-1 returned to the USS Sekhmet to find it under attack. Conrak and Val rushed to battle stations on the bridge where Admiral Stoker and Captain Vrenta were keeping things under control so far.The enemy ship was a strange slender design with masts holding up sails. It fired weapons with physical projectiles with surprising effectiveness. Conrak and Val coordinated to return fire quick, dealing some damage to its shields. The Enemy fired a harpoon, which pierced a hole in the shielding and began draining energy from the Sekhmet's hull. Bov organized an emergy response team to dislodge the harpoon.The enemy ship retreated behind the planet and came swinging around the other side, but Conrak and Val were ready for them. Bov diverted Reserve power to the weapons and Conrak disabled their shield. Then Val ordered a torpedo to be fired. Admiral Stoker doubled down on the order and asked for a full salvo of torpedoes, enough to completely obliterate the enemy ship. Conrak did fire a Salvo but intentionally missed with several of the torpedoes.Captain Vrenta stood up against the admiral, saying that firing on a defenseless ship was ground to arrest the Admiral, and that's exactly what happened. Further, the bridge crew from the enemy vessel was beamed onto the Sekhmet and arrested for interrogation. They blood red skin and high collar bones. They called themselves the Vinshari. Bov Tovan
mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-5.3-vi.sourcePath: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 5.3 - Vinshari Attack.md

uss-sekhmet.html.title: USS Sekhmet
uss-sekhmet.html.description:
Summary Location:: The Shackleton Expanse
Portrait:: Note:: Pulled back into service to supplement Starfleet's overextended fleet, the USS Sekhmet stands on guard over Narendra station and the Shackleton Expanse beyond. The USS Sekmet is a Columbia Class cruiser stationed at Narendra Station. After the bombings on the Mars Utopia Planitia shipyards, Starfleet supplemented it's fleet by pulling retired vessels back into service with substantial refits.The Sekhmet carries a crew of a little over 100 crewman and officers. Federation Starship Columbia Class Garbage Scow Sekhmet is the Egyptian goddess of war and medicine. The USS Sekhmet is the first of it's name, and was chosen to signal it's equal potential as a protector and threat.The USS Sekhmet, has been assigned to Narendra station as an emergency response and tactical strike starship. While Sekhmet has a regular crew, the Narendra Station provides a rotating roster of commanding officers due to stretched personnel resources and the Sekhmet's irregular mission schedule.
Sekhmet Log 1.1 - Bacchus' Irresistible Call: Stardate 67156, Session: 1The Sekhmet investgated a missing science team at Bacchus-3, only to get caught in the same subspace distortion wave and became stranded. On the planet, they found the team strange entranced by massive monoliths, even willing to die to get inside.The USS Sekhmet was sent to investigate the disappearance of a Starfleet science shuttle at the Bacchus system. When the Sekhmet arrived, it was violently thrown out of warp by a massive subspace distortion wave. A small coalition team of Starfleet and Klingon officers seemed entranced by the giant monoliths sticking out of the surface of the planet. Soon, the scientists opened the monoliths, revealing a facility on the inside. Two of the closest scientists threw themselves into the facility, getting vaporized instantly.

Sorran Vek found that D'Lok, a Klingon, at a brainwave resonating with the subspace distortion frequency.Conrak phasered one of the two phaser arrays guarding the entrance, which activated a security system closing the door. Conrak rushed forward and held the door open while Val disabled the second one. The away team entered the spire, leaving a small security team to guard the restrained scientists.Inside, the engineering specialist Victoria noted the amounts of power running through the spire was no enormous there were very few practical uses for it all. But it was enough power to punch wormholes through space-time. At the center of the spire, the found a control room with consoles for security, power management, subspace field generation, and more. They disabled the security system first, and then turned off the subspace field generator.An automated hologram projection of an alien introduced themselves as representing the "Displaced." The implored the group to find something called "The Facility" but didn't know where it was. It said its people were in peril and asked for the away team to go save them. It directed the away to to collect a bread-box sized sandstone prism with runes carved along the outside.The automated messenger finally urged them to leave quickly, because their ship would be in danger. The spires of Bacchus-3 was tractoring the nearest planet towards it, ripping the planet apart as it went. It was rebuilding a new Spire to replace the disabled one. A meteor shower threatened to destroy the Sekhmet and a disabled Klingon vessel. The away team and others on the surface returned to the SekhmetThe Klingon vessel had arrived to find their "compatriots", and demanded to have them returned. Val convinced the Klingons that if they allowed the Sekhmet to tractor them out of the system to safety, then the fugitives would be returned, with an implication that they would be set free.However, the commanding officer Vrenta Ewasi instead ordered the Sekhmet to rendezvous with Starfleet vessels answering a distress signal. The Klingons were arrest, and the Sekhmet praised for not only saving the survey team, but also bringing in wanted criminals.
Sekhmet Log 2 - Peas to Meet You: Stardate 67197, Session: 3The Sekhmet assisted the USS Constantine in delivering a crucial agricultural exchange to a colony in the Bix system. The crew and passengers of the Constantine had succumbed to a neurotoxin produced by Ice Peas while not in it's natural habitat.The USS Sekhmet was sent to investigate the USS Constantine, a Galaxy Class starship itself tasked with transporting an agricultural exchange from the Colony on Re-Alpha to a struggling colony on Bix. Aboard the Sekhmet, a boarding party found the crew of the Constantine acting strangely. The Executive officer ambushed the party, seemingly paranoid that they were intruders. The Captain was engaged in some sort of wrestling tournament, and various other crew members were exhibiting strong emotional reactions.The boarding party found the crew was under the effects of a neurotoxin called Wexylin-5C, which would cause different reactions from each person as a stress response. They tracked down the source of this neurotoxin to a plan on board called Ice Peas. The colonists had brought the crop on board and were sharing the food with the crew. The crop had been removed from it's natural habitat and was creating this neurotoxin in response to losing a particular fungus in it's soil. The boarding party was able to reintroduce the fungus into the Ice Pea bushes soil substitute, and bring the crew back to normal.
Sekhmet Log 3 - Orion Heist: Stardate 67217, Session: 4The Sekhmet was sent to pursue an Orion freighter which had stolen the Bacchus Artifact. The chase lead to the Romulan neutral zone. Before the Sekhmet could tractor beam the freighter and head back to base, a Romulan Warbird decloaked. The Sekhmet disabled the freighter's shields, beamed the artifact aboard, and fled the neutral zone before the Warbird could break the Sekhmet's own shields.While Lt Sorran was studying the Bacchus artifact, Lt Kassandra Pruitt, suffered a massive neural failure cascade, sending her to the emergency room. Meanwhile the Artifact was stolen from the lab. Admiral Banna Stoker gave instructions to the Sekhmet to find it. The artifact could not be located on the station, and only 2 starships had left Narendra Station recently.The Sekhmet started by chasing down a Klingon Bird of Prey, who turned out to be innocent. This mistake meant an Orion Freighter made it all the way to the Romulan Neutral Zone before the Sekhmet caught up. In the neutral zone, they found the back end of the freighter caved in like an aluminum can, with some kind of gravity field compressing the ship's hull.Lt. Commander Val ordered the freighter to be hulled away with a tractor beam, but in the same moment a Romulan decloaked and caught the freighter in it's own tractor beam. This lead to a brief firefight. The Sekhmet disabled the Orion freighters shields and beamed the artifact aboard. The artifact was still attached to an Orion via a telepathic link which would kill him if removed forcefully.The the Orion freighter captain, Paljara, begged Val to send the artifact back, as it was ransom for her sister's life. Val refused to comply. The Romulan captain also threatened the Sekhmet, warning of dire consequences if the artifact and the Orion were not returned.In the end, the Sekhmet managed to charge it's warp drive and race back to Narendra station. Admiral Stoker commended the Sekhmet for a job well done. But as the Sekhmet retreated, the Romulans had destroyed the Orion freighter.
Sekhmet Log 4 - Imminent Collision: Stardate 67233, Session: 5The Sekhmet made first contact with a new species made of crystal that communicated with refracted light. They crew assisted the aliens by removing an unidentified torpedo from the hull, and sent them on their way.After Narendra Station picked up an unidentified object approaching the station at high warp speeds, the USS Sekhmet was sent to investigate while the station prepared for a potential attack. They found a strange crystalline starship and attempted rudimentary and cooperative communication with it. On board the crystal starship, the crew found an unidentified torpedo lodged into the side of the structure, seemingly made just for the purpose of attacking this kind of starship. As the hull of the ship seemed to be a living entity of some sort, an away team organized a surgical bomb disposal procedure to remove the torpedo safely. This triggered the torpedo to explode and it was sent into space with an emergency transport.Once the torpedo was removed, the strange crystal beings who communicated through light refraction departed back into the Shackleton Expanse.
Sekhmet Log 5.1 - The Pasqual Problem: Stardate 67255, Session: 6The Sekhmet picked up Admiral Stoker and was ordered to Pasqual-1. There, they found a planet cloaked in an electromagnetic field that interfered with sensors and would disable and electronic equipment. It was covered in hundreds of strange black obelisks, 3 stories tall, and was home to a pre-industrial civilization.Sorran and Val were continuing investigation into Bacchus Artifact by performing controlled mind melds into it. However, the artifact's signal overloaded the failsafe meant to protect Val. It was deemed unsafe to continue these kinds of investigations.A shuttle was found rushing out of the Shackleton Expanse and towards the Sekhmet. Admiral Stoker was aboard and had taken damage as if in a firefight. When she boarded, she ordered the Sekhmet to head towards the Pasqual system in the Shackleton. Investigation into the shuttle revealed that she had indeed gotten into a fight with an unknown civilization. Her shuttle had visited several systems in the Shackleton.After cleaning up, Stoker briefed the crew on their mission: Pasqual-1 was an M-Class planet with a strange electromagnetic field shielding it from sensors. Stoker expected this planet might have remnants from the same civilization as Bacchus. The crew was also to keep a lookout for enemy ships that may have followed Stoker's shuttleAfter the briefing, Stoker took Conrak and Val aside and made it clear that the civilian Hik was to be enlisted into the Starfleet command structure or be removed from the ship's crew. Hik would be given a suitable position for her experience.The Sekhmet arrived at Pasqual-1 and found it covered in approximately 500 black obsidian monoliths, each about 3 stories tall. Each one had a small settlement build around it from a pre-industrial civilization.The Sekhmet put together an away team for Pasqual-1, and beamed down even through the electromagnetic interference. They aimed several kilometers outside a settlement and intended to work their way in to investigate the monolith there. In the woods, the away team was attacked by 4 panther-like predators, which were then killed or scared away.On the way to the nearest monolith, the away team followed a river until they found a woman and two children by a waterfall. They were doing laundry. Each one looked to be a different species than the others altogether.
Sekhmet Log 5.2 - Monoliths: Stardate 67255, Session: 7Val, Conrak, Sorren, and Karnes explored Pasqual-1 and followed some locals back to a community built around a black monolith. They discovered that the monolith was performing genetic experiments and forcefully evolving the population, and then attempting to send it to the Seku system. The electromagnetic field seemed to be an unintended interaction of the monoliths and the planet's crust.Val, Conrak, Sorren, and Karnes approached the three locals of Pasqual-1 at the waterfall. After making introductions, Val was able to mind meld with the locals to communicate. The woman introduced herself as Zumala, and the two children were Tadbon and Klopflim. Val hid their true origins from Zumala during the mind meld, but Zumala was able to sense him holding back information.The away team followed the three Pasqualese into their town, and were introduced to their elder, Jasper. Sorren and Val investigated the monolith in the center of town while Conrak aquainted himself with the locals.During a shared dinner outdoors, the monolith lit up in blue lights and 12 people around it fell to the ground, convulsing as it electrocuted. The people of the village seemed worried about it, but expected it to happen.Val convinced Jasper to bring them underneath the monolith, which Jasper considered holy ground. But in the mind meld, Jasper gleaned that the away team with from the stars and interpreted that as the team being angels. He asked them to bring him with them to the stars and Val agreed (at least temporarily.)Underneath the monolith, the away team found a control room. After some investigation, they discovered the control room was attempting to send genetic information from the community out to the Seku system in the Shackleton Expanse. They also found that every 6 months or so, the tower would send a signal out to several members of the community to revise their DNA, and then their children would be born with new features.With this information, the away team decided to return to the transport pickup spot. They brought Jasper, but Jasper was left behind as they were beamed back onto the Sekhmet. The Sekhmet was in red alert, and under attack.
Sekhmet Log 5.3 - Vinshari Attack: Stardate 67255, Session: 8When the away team on Pasqual-1 returned to the Sekhmet, it was under attack from a starship crewed by the Vinshari, a new civilization. Conrak and Val were able to work efficiently as a team and quickly disabled the starship. The Vinshari claimed that the Admiral had stolen from them, and demanded the Admiral be handed over to them to face justice. In the end, Admiral Stoker was arrested for attempting to destroy the Vinshari starship while it was defenseless.The away team on Pasqual-1 returned to the USS Sekhmet to find it under attack. Conrak and Val rushed to battle stations on the bridge where Admiral Stoker and Captain Vrenta were keeping things under control so far.The enemy ship was a strange slender design with masts holding up sails. It fired weapons with physical projectiles with surprising effectiveness. Conrak and Val coordinated to return fire quick, dealing some damage to its shields. The Enemy fired a harpoon, which pierced a hole in the shielding and began draining energy from the Sekhmet's hull. Bov organized an emergy response team to dislodge the harpoon.The enemy ship retreated behind the planet and came swinging around the other side, but Conrak and Val were ready for them. Bov diverted Reserve power to the weapons and Conrak disabled their shield. Then Val ordered a torpedo to be fired. Admiral Stoker doubled down on the order and asked for a full salvo of torpedoes, enough to completely obliterate the enemy ship. Conrak did fire a Salvo but intentionally missed with several of the torpedoes.Captain Vrenta stood up against the admiral, saying that firing on a defenseless ship was ground to arrest the Admiral, and that's exactly what happened. Further, the bridge crew from the enemy vessel was beamed onto the Sekhmet and arrested for interrogation. They blood red skin and high collar bones. They called themselves the Vinshari.

info_showCustomIcons.description: Show custom icons for files and folders

info_showDefaultFolderIcons.description: Show a default icon of a folder for every folder in the tree

info_showDefaultFileIcons.description: Show a default icon of a file for every file in the tree

info_defaultFolderIcon.description: The icon to use for folders. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultFileIcon.description: The icon to use for files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultMediaIcon.description: The icon to use for media files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_exposeStartingPath.description: Whether or not to show the current file in the file tree when the page is first loaded

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded

info_siteUrl.description: The url that this site will be hosted at

info_siteName.description: The name of the vault / exported site

info_authorName.description: The name of the author of the site
